title: Type Design 101
content:
Im entering my last year of Design School and wanted to start working on typeface design and move it beyond just sketches and vector illustrations.

Ive purchased Fontlab Studio and am begining to learn the workings of the program. The advice I seek is an approach to designing whole alphabets … tips on consistency tips on everything. This may be a topic elsewhere, if so I will hopefully find it. Again any first timer tricks or tips would be greatly appreciated.

Cheers
author: JSDOCA

comments.content:
My advice? Play around.

You’re not going to make an amazing font on your first try, but the more you play around with your tools (not just computer tools, but pencil, paper, etc. too) the more you will learn how they work. Since you say you’re in last year, you’ve probably done this a lot.

You should check out the [how-to](http://web.archive.org/wiki/how-to) wiki.

- Lex

Leslie Cabarga’s Logo, Fonts & Lettering Bible is one place to start.

T

Also Leslie Cabarga’s ‘Learn FontLab fast’.

Nick Cooke
another wiki entry that might help [FAQ\_Design](http://web.archive.org/wiki/FAQ_Design)

James, I teach a night-time typeface design class at ArtCenter in Pasadena.  
The next semester starts in January.

hhp
